title.value: Information Complexity of Stochastic Convex Optimization: Applications to Generalization, Memorization, and Tracing
title.justification: The title is clearly indicated at the top of the document, reflecting the main topics discussed in the paper.
title.quote: Information Complexity of Stochastic Convex Optimization: Applications to Generalization, Memorization, and Tracing

extractions.description: This paper investigates the relationship between memorization and generalization in stochastic convex optimization (SCO), using theoretical information complexity measures such as conditional mutual information (CMI). It introduces new bounds on CMI for learning algorithms and explores how memorization might be necessary for generalization in modern machine learning contexts.

type.justification: The paper primarily presents theoretical analysis and derivations regarding information complexity and memorization.
type.quote: In this work, we investigate the interplay between memorization and learning in the context of stochastic convex optimization (SCO). We define memorization via the information a learning algorithm reveals about its training data points.

name.justification: The paper deals with stochastic convex optimization, generalization, and memorization within the broader field of machine learning.
name.quote: In recent years, SCO has been shown to serve as a useful theoretical model for understanding generalization in modern machine learning.

name.justification: The focus of the paper is on stochastic convex optimization as a method to understand generalization.
name.quote: In this work, we investigate the interplay between memorization and learning in the context of stochastic convex optimization (SCO).

name.justification: The paper uses concepts from information theory, such as conditional mutual information (CMI), to analyze learning algorithms.
name.quote: We then quantify this information using the framework of conditional mutual information (CMI) proposed by Steinke and Zakynthinou [SZ20].
